info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:32PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Mobile County through 315 PM CDT... At 232 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Grand Bay, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Tillmans Corner, Saraland, Theodore, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Grand Bay, Semmes, Tanner Williams, I65 And I165, Mobile Regional Airport, I65 And AL 158 and I10 And I65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
